messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.

You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 2
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: A former bodyguard who killed his team leader. He is set to stand trial soon.
Character 3
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A defense attorney I have known for a long time, but haven't seen in years. Apparently, he lived abroad for a while.
Character 4
Name: Rocco Carcerato
Description: An inmate and former boxer who is obsessed with training. Has a pet polar bear named Teddy.
Character 5
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 6
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who's taken over my cases on the Committee's orders.
Character 7
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: The suspect in this case. A timid young man who seems an unlikely murderer.
Character 8
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: Warden of the prison. An animal lover who considers physical contact to be very important.
Character 9
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
Character 10
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.
Character 11
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Building Layout
Description: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.
Evidence 2
Name: Mr. Knight's Body
Description: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. [info] The victim had a ring on his right hand, which was covered by a sheet when the body was discovered.  Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.
Evidence 3
Name: Pocket Chess Set
Description: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim. A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint. Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard. Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.
Evidence 4
Name: Rubber Glove
Description: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.
Evidence 5
Name: Rope
Description: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?
Evidence 6
Name: Bloodstained Sheet
Description: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.
Evidence 7
Name: Door Sensor
Description: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets when they are near by raising the alarm. They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.
Evidence 8
Name: Prison Roll Call
Description: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.
Evidence 9
Name: Black Dog
Description: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.
Evidence 10
Name: Sahwit's Bracelet
Description: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors. Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.
Evidence 11
Name: Dog Chess Piece
Description: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.
Evidence 12
Name: Prison Search
Description: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.
Evidence 13
Name: Wiped Floor
Description: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean. There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.
Evidence 14
Name: Chess Diagram
Description: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell. Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form. The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.
Evidence 16
Name: Missing Guard Uniform
Description: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.
Evidence 17
Name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
Description: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered. A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.
Evidence 18
Name: Security Gates
Description: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.
Evidence 19
Name: Tunnel Prints
Description: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog. A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.
Evidence 20
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous. Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.
Evidence 21
Name: Chisel
Description: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it. Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.
Evidence 22
Name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Recreation time ended around 10 AM.
Person: Elbird
Testimony 1
Testimony: I returned to this room and went straight to my training.
Person: Elbird
Testimony 2
Testimony: Just as I'd counted to two, I heard a voice shout out, "AAARGH! I've been stabbed!"
Person: Elbird
Testimony 3
Testimony: It sounded like someone in pain, calling out for help. But...
Person: Elbird
Testimony 4
Testimony: I couldn't do anything since I was locked up in my cell. So, I went back to my training.
Person: Elbird

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
You are a helpful assistant.

Character 9
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
Character 10
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.
Character 11
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Building Layout
Description: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.
Evidence 2
Name: Mr. Knight's Body
Description: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.
Evidence 3
Name: Pocket Chess Set
Description: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim. A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint. Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard. Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.
Evidence 4
Name: Rubber Glove
Description: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.
Evidence 5
Name: Rope
Description: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?
Evidence 6
Name: Bloodstained Sheet
Description: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.
Evidence 7
Name: Door Sensors
Description: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets by raising the alarm. They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.
Evidence 8
Name: Prison Roll Call
Description: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.
Evidence 9
Name: Black Dog
Description: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.
Evidence 10
Name: Sahwit's Bracelet
Description: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors. Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.
Evidence 11
Name: Dog Chess Piece
Description: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.
Evidence 12
Name: Prison Search
Description: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.
Evidence 13
Name: Wiped Floor
Description: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean. There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.
Evidence 14
Name: Chess Diagram
Description: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell. Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form. The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.
Evidence 16
Name: Missing Guard Uniform
Description: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.
Evidence 17
Name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
Description: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered. A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.
Evidence 18
Name: Security Gates
Description: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.
Evidence 19
Name: Tunnel Prints
Description: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog. A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.
Evidence 20
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous. Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.
Evidence 21
Name: Chisel
Description: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it. Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.
Evidence 22
Name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights that drop into the well were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I wouldn't go so far as to call it an interrogation.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 1
Testimony: Around 3 AM the day before the show, the victim was brought into my office.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 2
Testimony: I always make sure to talk to all the new arrivals.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 3
Testimony: Mr. Knightley... Yes, we had a little chat.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 4
Testimony: After our talk, he went right back to his cell, I assure you.
Person: Laguarde
Testimony 5
Testimony: Kanis was the one I hated. And he had no connection with the victim.
Person: Laguarde

Description: The detective assigned to this case. A man of few words.

Name: Carmelo Gusto
Description: A candy-crafting confectioner who's taking part in the contest.

Name: Delicia Scone
Description: A confectioner who will do whatever it takes to achieve her goals.

Name: Manfred von Karma
Description: The prosecutor in charge of this case. It is said that he has never lost a trial in these past 25 years.

Name: Laurice Deauxnim
Description: Pseudonym of Larry Butz, my friend since childhood. He fancies himself as something of an artist.

Name: Dick Gumshoe

Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. Polishing it every day has become just another part of my daily routine.
Evidence 1
Name: Seal
Description: A seal that was found near the body when it was discovered. What could the design signify?
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes about the crime scene. The police have taken custody of the body. [info] The victim's body found in Samson Tangaroa's room, inside a chocolate treasure chest. The cause of death appears to have been blood loss following blunt force trauma. [caption] The victim's body is curled inside a chest crushed by a ship post. The body is half covered by a blue sheet. There is a silver coin next to the body.
Evidence 3
Name: Mr. Tangaroa's Teapot
Description: A Paul Halique piece with Tangaroa's fingerprints on it.
Evidence 4
Name: Contest Rules
Description: A piece of paper listing the rules for the contest.
Evidence 5
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Someone left finger marks on the chocolate frame, but didn't leave any prints.
Evidence 6
Name: Mansion Key
Description: The one and only key that unlocks every door in the mansion. Tangaroa was in possession of it the entire time.
Evidence 7
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: Salt lamp found in Scone's room. Stained with the victim's blood.
Evidence 8
Name: Fake Confections
Description: Ms. Scone's so-called creations were all fake plastic models, covered in a thick layer of whipped cream.
Evidence 9
Name: Chocolates
Description: Tangaroa's favorite, handmade by Bound. Rather misshapened, and incredibly sweet.
Evidence 10
Name: Instant Camera
Description: Takes photos that develop instantly. A new film cartridge has twenty exposures, but there are only three remaining.
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Frost's Room
Description: A photo of Frost's sculptures, taken by Judy Bound. Two photos, one from Bound and one from Detective Badd.
Evidence 12
Name: Ms. Scone's Statement
Description: Frost's sculptures were "scrumptious", except for the lyre, which was salty.
Evidence 13
Name: Semifinal Entries
Description: Frost's and Gusto's creations had different designs, but tasted the same.
Evidence 14
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 15
Name: Victim's Blood
Description: Frost's blood was found in the fountain, but not at the scene of the crime.
Evidence 16
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 17
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 18
Name: IS-7 Incident Case File
Description: Documents providing an overview of the IS-7 Incident. Documents received from Fender, including his comments in red.
Evidence 19
Name: Gallery Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet received upon entry to the gallery.
Evidence 20
Name: Winter Wing Photo
Description: Statues matching those made by the victim eighteen years ago.
Evidence 21
Name: Pisces Statue Sketch
Description: A sketch by Larry depicting the Pisces statue exactly as he saw it.
Evidence 22
Name: Used Blowtorch
Description: There are signs it was used just before the police arrived. Possibly to heat something?
Evidence 23
Name: Luminous Cloth
Description: Cloth that glows when connected to a full-spectrum light-emitting device. [caption] Looks like a blue sheet. Delicia Scone's property. One of these was lost eighteen years ago. Given to Bound by Scone. Lost eighteen years ago, only to be rediscovered floating in the fountain.
Evidence 24
Name: Poison Gas Ingredients
Description: The gas was produced when bright red Ubiquium and pure white Asphyxion were mixed together.
Evidence 25
Name: Ultimate Cookbook
Description: A book containing formulas for creating a cure for taste disorders and other chemical and pharmaceutical items.
Evidence 26
Name: Frame Finger Marks
Description: Finger marks left by someone in Tangaroa's room. No accompanying prints.
Evidence 27
Name: Salt Lamp
Description: A photograph of the murder weapon from the IS-7 Incident. It's a salt lamp stained with Frost's blood.
Evidence 28
Name: Family Photo
Description: A photo of Frost, Gusto, and their sons. Gusto's son visited his father daily up through the semifinal.
Evidence 29
Name: Teapot
Description: Designed by Paul Halique. One of Judy Bound's prize possessions.
Evidence 30
Name: Ceramic Fragment
Description: Found in a puddle of tea. The design looks familiar.
Evidence 31
Name: Lift Cart
Description: Used by Frost to transport ice eighteen years ago. The top of the platform is wet.
Evidence 32

Description: Sketches depicting exactly what Larry saw.
Evidence 33

Description: Results of the analysis conducted on the melted contents of the Gemini case.

Description: Handmade by Bound. Slightly melted after being kept in her pocket.

Description: A book explaining the statutes of limitations of various crimes.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: If you want to know about Gusto and Frost's connection so badly, I'll tell you.
Person: von Karma
Testimony 1
Testimony: Last night, when I interrogated Gusto, he told me about his connection with Frost.
Person: von Karma
Testimony 2
Testimony: Until the day before the finals, they worked on their desserts together.
Person: von Karma
Testimony 3
Testimony: Why? Because Gusto had poor design sense, and Frost was a novice at baking.
Person: von Karma
Testimony 4
Testimony: Their cooperation lasted only through the semifinals. For the finals, they were on their own.
Person: von Karma

Evidence 36
Name: Statute of Limitations
Description: A book explaining the statutes of limitations of various crimes. [info] There are several conditions under which the time limit can be put on hold and extended:
If a suspect goes to a foreign country, then the time limit is put on hold until they return.
If any possible accomplices are put on trial, then the time limit is put on hold until the accomplice's verdict is reached.
If charges are pressed to demand compensation, then the time limit is put on hold until this procedure is cleared up.

['Lotta:\nIt was a black market auction, after all. They followed a fairly detailed procedure. First, the participants entered the storeroom from the viewin\' platform one at a time. When they got in, they each took one of those masks on the wall over there... Funny thing \'bout those masks... They\'re all equipped with voice changers. Itty bitty ones. That way they wouldn\'t be recognized. They wanted to protect their... "an anemone"?\nEma:\nYou mean... their "anonymity"?\nLotta:\nYeah, that\'s it! Their "anomnintany"!\nEdgeworth:\n(Why not just say "identity" and make things easier for all of us...?)\nLotta:\nAfter puttin\' on the mask, they\'d go down the lift, and the next feller would come right in. On the way back, it was the exact same thing, but in reverse. They\'d come up one by one, return the mask, and head up outta the storeroom.', "Ema:\nWell then, let's head on down!\nRay:\nOh, have we decided on our next destination? Heeeey, Kay!\nKay:\nY-Yes, Mr. Shields!\nRay:\nWe wouldn't want you to get lost, so make sure you stay real close to Uncle Ray, kay?\nKay:\nRight! I'll follow you closely, Mr. Shields.\nEdgeworth:\n(These two... Since when did they get along like that?)\nInvestigation Complete\nApril 5, 7:43 PMGrand TowerP.I.C. Meeting Room"]

Characters:
Character 0
Name: Susato Mikotoba
Description: A judicial assistant sent to Britain on a study tour. She's the epitome of a refined Japanese lady and a huge help to me always.
Character 1
Name: Mael Stronghart
Description: The Lord Chief Justice, who wields absolute authority in judicial matters, including the appointment of lawyers. He's a thoroughly intimidating man.
Character 2
Name: Magnus McGilded
Description: The defendant in this case. He's an incredibly wealthy philanthropist with a wonderful reputation in London. I'm to defend him as a test of my worthiness to become a lawyer.
Character 3
Name: Barok van Zieks
Description: A prosecutor known as the Reaper of the Bailey. Supposedly, the souls of those he prosecutes are eternally damned, one way or another.
Character 4
Name: 'Thrice-Fired' Mason
Description: The victim. A skilled but poor brickmaker who apparently owed the defendant a considerable sum of money.
Character 5
Name: Beppo
Description: The driver of the omnibus on which the murder took place. He's an eyewitness to the incident.
Character 6
Name: Bruce Fairplay
Description: A gentleman who works as a city banker. He witnessed the incident from his seat on the roof deck of the omnibus.
Character 7
Name: Lay D. Furst
Description: An apprentice milliner who witnessed the incident from his seat on the roof deck of the omnibus.
Character 8
Name: Gina Lestrade
Description: A young woman who witnessed the incident from her hiding place aboard the omnibus on the night of the murder. She was discovered by the defendant.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.
Evidence 1
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: A report prepared by the Scotland Yard coroner. It gives the cause of death as internal haemorrhaging as a result of a single stab wound to the abdomen.
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photograph of the victim taken on the omnibus. The knife in his abdomen is clearly visible, but his face is partly obscured from view by an old, crooked hat.
Evidence 3
Name: Defendant's Leather Gloves
Description: The leather gloves the defendant was wearing at the time of the incident. There is a bloodstain on the right glove.
Evidence 4
Name: Omnibus
Description: The eight-seater omnibus that was the scene of the crime. There were passengers both inside the carriage and on the roof deck that night. The scene of the crime. There is a bloodstain visible on the frame of the skylight when it's open.
Evidence 5
Name: Murder Weapon
Description: A largish knife that was found lodged in the victim's abdomen. Its quality and fancy ornamentation suggest it must be quite valuable.
Evidence 6
Name: Debtors' Ledger
Description: A catalogue of people who had borrowed money from the defendant at a high rate of interest. It includes the victim, who owed twenty guineas. Among the defendant's list of debtors is Bruce Fairplay, who would have been due to repay his loan imminently.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I, I only c-carried f-four passengers that night! I swear it! ...B-B-But, um...
Person: Beppo
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well, I for one was told I had to pay fivepence for the bus.
Person: Fairplay
Testimony 2
Testimony: He fiddled us on the fare, he did! And then I saw that blood-curdling sight as well... It's all too much!
Person: Furst
Testimony 3
Testimony: I tell you, I saw McGilded stabbing that man! Everything I said before stands!
Person: Fairplay
Testimony 4
Testimony: Oh yes... Yes, he s-s-stabbed him. Yes he did. ...I, I think so, yes.
Person: Beppo
Testimony 5
Testimony: D'you think I'd forget the sight of those blood-soaked hands after that butcher stabbed the man?!
Person: Fairplay

Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.

Name: Music Box Disk
Description: A metal disk used to play music in a mechanical music box. The piece of music, which remains unidentified, is stored on the disk by means of small protrusions. A metal disk used to play music in a mechanical music box. On the reverse side is a note that reads, 'For McGilded'.
Evidence 2
Name: White Cat Photograph → Pawnbroker's Ticket (Box)
Description: A photograph depicting a sweet little white cat, obtained from Gina while interviewing her in her prison cell. A redemption ticket issued from the pawnbrokery owned by the victim, Mr Windibank, in the form of some hand-written notes on the back of a photograph.
Evidence 3
Name: Gina's Representation Papers
Description: The paperwork signed by Gina to put me in charge of her defence. Showing this to Scotland Yard detectives gains us access to the crime scene.
Evidence 4
Name: White Cat Photograph #2 → Pawnbroker's Ticket (Coat)
Description: A photograph depicting a sweet little white cat. I feel as though I have another print just like this one... A redemption ticket issued from the pawnbrokery owned by the victim, Mr Windibank. The blood on it has been identified as Mr Mason's.
Evidence 5
Name: Blood Samples Portfolio
Description: A sample of blood analysed with a special chemical indicator developed by Mr Sholmes. Different people's blood turns different colours.
Evidence 6
Name: Iris's Story Manuscript
Description: A long, unpublished story that Mr Sholmes deposited at the pawnbrokery of the victim, Mr Windibank. It's entitled 'The Hound of the Baskervilles'.
Evidence 7
Name: McGilded Case Notes
Description: Notes collated by Miss Susato about the McGilded case that we worked on two months ago.
Evidence 8
Name: Today's Paper
Description: This morning's paper, purchased by Iris. Gina's case features prominently. This morning's paper, which contains an article about government secrets being leaked to foreign agencies.
Evidence 9
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: A report prepared by the Scotland Yard coroner that confirms instant death due to a single bullet wound from the back. There are no other signs of trauma.
Evidence 10
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photograph of the victim found murdered in the storeroom. It shows the single bullet wound in the man's back.
Evidence 11
Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of Windibank's pawnbrokery, the scene of the crime. It shows the relative positions of the main shop and the rear storeroom.
Evidence 12
Name: Windibank's Gun
Description: A gun belonging to the victim, Mr Windibank, that Gina was holding when she was found unconscious. There are signs of a single discharge.
Evidence 13
Name: Skulkin Brothers' Gun
Description: A firearm found in the possession of the Skulkin brothers upon their arrest. There are signs that a single round was fired.
Evidence 14
Name: Photograph of Gina
Description: A photograph taken automatically by the Red-Handed Recorder showing the scene a short time before the murder took place.
Evidence 15
Name: Post-Shooting Photograph
Description: A photograph taken automatically by the Red-Handed Recorder showing the scene after the murder had taken place.
Evidence 16
Name: Stereoscope
Description: A fold-up device that allows anybody to enjoy seeing things in three dimensions simply by looking through the eyepieces.
Evidence 17
Name: Sholmes's Pouch
Description: The pouch Mr Sholmes was wearing around his waist at the time of the shooting. One of the glass phials is smashed and there are scorch marks around it.
Evidence 18
Name: The Third Bullet
Description: A projectile we discovered lodged in Mr Sholmes's pouch. It caused one of the phials to explode, injuring Mr Sholmes.
Evidence 19
Name: Small Music Box
Description: This strange music box only appears to be able to play a single tone. It was deposited at Windibank's two days before the black overcoat.
Evidence 20
Name: Cat-Flapomat
Description: A compact machine for the rapid creation of small flaps in larger doors, to allow cats to come and go freely.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Alright, we did knock a few things over. But we weren't riflin' fer nuffin'!
Person: Nash
Testimony 1
Testimony: It woz when we 'eard the gunshot, see. Made us both jump, an' all that stuff went flyin'.
Person: Ringo
Testimony 2
Testimony: Just before the gunshot, we 'eard a voice yellin' out, 'Gimme that gun!'
Person: Ringo
Testimony 3
Testimony: The bloke wot owned the place was 'oldin' a gun, so 'e should 'ave just fired instead of yellin' at the girl!
Person: Nash
Testimony 4
Testimony: Lummy, it didn't 'alf gimme a fright! We woz thinkin' the shooter'd come out the door and get us next.
Person: Nash
Testimony 5
Testimony: We stuck everyfin' back where we found it and scarpered...straight into 'im in the black.
Person: Ringo
Testimony 6
Testimony: We couldn't 'ave shot the pawnbroker, see! We never even 'ad a chance, did we?
Person: Nash

Characters:
Character 0
Name: Yujin Mikotoba
Description: A medical professor at the Imperial Yumei University. He is an authority in forensic science in charge of the university's laboratory. He also happens to be my father.
Character 1
Name: Rei Membami
Description: An assistant to my father in his laboratory at the Imperial Yumei University. She's my best friend, and considers herself very much indebted to the late Dr John Wilson.
Character 2
Name: Jezaille Brett
Description: The victim of the case who was a former British exchange student. Nine months ago, she was found guilty of the murder of visiting professor Dr John Wilson.
Character 3
Name: Taketsuchi Auchi
Description: The lead prosecutor of this case, who appears to be struggling to accept the changes afoot as a result of these turbulent new times in Japan - the Meiji era.
Character 4
Name: Satoru Hosonaga
Description: A chief inspector in the Imperial Police Bureau who was surreptitiously submerged in the sea in order to keep watch over Miss Brett. He was present at the time of her murder.
Character 5
Name: Soseki Natsume
Description: A former visiting student to the British empire who returned to Japan after a spell of bad luck with the law. He's now a successful author and a witness in the current case.
Character 6
Name: Raiten Menimemo
Description: A journalist for the Shoyu News who's currently following Soseki-san everywhere, reporting on his every move. As a result, he's an eyewitness to the incident.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Post-Mortem Report
Description: Time of death just after 2 p.m. Death is believed to be due to trauma to the victim's lung from a knife blade. Only a single wound was identified.
Evidence 1
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the scene taken by police just after the incident occurred. The stab wound in the victim's back is clearly visible.
Evidence 2
Name: Soseki Natsume Article
Description: A newspaper containing an article about a discussion between my father and Soseki-san. The debate became quite spirited.
Evidence 3
Name: Fountain Pen
Description: The pen that the victim was found grasping in her hand. It carries the initials 'R.M.'. The fountain pen that the victim was found grasping in her hand. It carries the initials 'R.M.' as well as an emblem of some description. A fountain pen bearing the initials 'R.M.' and an emblem of some description. There is a very small amount of liquid still inside the ink reservoir.
Evidence 4
Name: Poison Article
Description: An article about poison that was stolen from a laboratory at Yumei University. Even my father, who is responsible for the lab, knew nothing of the incident. An article about poison that was stolen from a laboratory at Yumei University. The reporter, Menimemo-san, based it on information he gleaned by eavesdropping.
Evidence 5
Name: Incriminating Photograph
Description: A photographic print taken at the moment the victim was attacked. My friend Rei can be seen kneeling over Miss Brett.
Evidence 6
Name: Chemical Reagent
Description: A special indicator solution for a new poison under development by my father's team. It's been created in strict secrecy and exists only in my father's laboratory.
Evidence 7
Name: Murder Weapon
Description: A small knife from the scene of the crime that was found in the victim's back. No trace of poison was found on the blade.
Evidence 8
Name: Beach Hut Plan
Description: A plan of the layout of the small beach hut where the victim was found.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the incident, I was ordered on a special surveillance assignment in this disguise.
Person: Hosonaga
Testimony 1
Testimony: I'd just managed to catch that crab when I suddenly heard a caterwaul from behind me.
Person: Soseki
Testimony 2
Testimony: I ran into the beach hut at once, where I found the pair in question.
Person: Hosonaga
Testimony 3
Testimony: YES YES YES! That young girl was astride the Englishwoman, dagger in hand, as she stabbed wildly!
Person: Soseki
Testimony 4
Testimony: I saw blood on the blade. It proved to me that she'd stabbed the victim multiple times.
Person: Hosonaga

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: The beach hut was made of shoddy old reed screens, so there were plenty of gaps I could see inside through.
Person: Menimemo
Testimony 1
Testimony: The Englishwoman was sitting on a stool when the student girl came in and started arguing with her.
Person: Menimemo
Testimony 2

Person: Menimemo
Testimony 3
Testimony: My smouldering journo spirit burst into flames! Quick as a flash, I whipped out my camera ready to click!
Person: Menimemo
Testimony 4

Person: Menimemo

Person: Menimemo

Characters:
Character 0
Name: Susato Mikotoba
Description: A judicial assistant sent to Britain on a study tour. She's the epitome of a refined Japanese lady and a huge help to me always.
Character 1
Name: Iris Wilson
Description: An extraordinary young girl who lives with Mr Sholmes. She has a degree in medicine and is the author of a popular series of short stories.
Character 2
Name: Herlock Sholmes
Description: There's not a person in the world who hasn't heard of this famous great detective, whose deductions never fail to surprise.
Character 3
Name: Olive Green
Description: An art-school student whose ambition is to become an artist. She's just regained consciousness, having been comatose for days after suffering a stab to from the back.
Character 4
Name: Soseki Natsume
Description: A Japanese scholar sent to London to further his research into the English language. He's just been acquitted of a very serious crime.↳A Japanese scholar sent to London to further his research into the English language. He's just been acquitted of a very serious crime, but now finds himself accused of another.
Character 5
Name: Tobias Gregson
Description: The detective inspector in charge of Scotland Yard's investigation of the case. He's stern and single-minded in his approach, and a great lover of fish and chips.
Character 6
Name: William Shamspeare
Description: The victim of the current case - a failed actor renting a room in the same building as Mr Natsume's lodgings.
Character 7
Name: John Garrideb
Description: A retired army man who's the landlord of the lodgings rented by the defendant, Mr Natsume. An old knee injury means he's confined to a chair most of the time.
Character 8
Name: Barok van Zieks
Description: A prosecutor known as the Reaper of the Bailey. Supposedly, the souls of those he prosecutes are eternally damned, one way or another.
Character 9
Name: Adron B. Metermann
Description: A young man who works for Altamont Gas. He's a witness to the incident.
Character 10
Name: Quinby Altamont
Description: The wife of the owner of the Altamont Gas Company. She's a staunch believer in the superiority of the fuel and utterly unforgiving of gas theft.
Character 11
Name: Duncan Ross
Description: The love of Miss Green's life, who sadly passed away a month ago as a result of gas poisoning.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.
Evidence 1
Name: Secondhand Book Receipt
Description: A receipt for some books that Mr Natsume purchased at a secondhand bookshop. It was submitted as evidence in the trial the other day.
Evidence 2
Name: Nearby Street Map
Description: A street map of the neighbourhood where Mr Natsume has his lodgings. It was submitted as evidence in the trial the other day.
Evidence 3
Name: Pair of Teacups
Description: The teacups used by Mr Shamspeare and Mr Natsume. The one with the green line around the rim was Mr Natsume's. The teacups used by Mr Shamspeare and Mr Natsume. There is no tea ring on the inside of Mr Natsume's cup.
Evidence 4
Name: Torn-Off End of Envelope
Description: A ripped piece of an envelope that was found in Mr Shamspeare's room. The rest of the envelope could not be located. A ripped piece of an envelope that was found in Mr Shamspeare's room. It fits perfectly with an envelope in Miss Green's possession.
Evidence 5
Name: Bar of Soap
Description: A cheap bar of soap that was discovered just outside Mr Shamspeare's window. It's one of two that were found there. A cheap bar of soap that was discovered just outside Mr Shamspeare's window. There is a two centimetre diameter circular depression in the middle of one surface.
Evidence 6
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the scene taken by police upon their arrival. The victim can be seen unconscious at the table, having been poisoned.
Evidence 7
Name: Victim's Medical Report
Description: A report issued by Scotland Yard's medical officer. It obviously mentions the poison as well as other details gleaned during the police investigation.
Evidence 8
Name: Gas Meter
Description: A meter that dispenses gas for a set time after a coin is inserted. It sports a very strong lock, especially with Mr Shamspeare in mind. A meter that dispenses gas for a set time after a coin is inserted. The attached coin box sports a very strong lock, and there is a tiny hole in its base.
Evidence 9
Name: Handprints on the Wall
Description: Traces of handprints on the wall, discovered using the Skin Print Seeker gun. There are multiple prints on either side of a hanging picture.
Evidence 10
Name: Capital Offender Article
Description: A newspaper article about Selden, a criminal sentenced to receive the death penalty. However, he died of illness in prison whilst his loot remained undiscovered.
Evidence 11
Name: Hidden Photograph
Description: A photographic print found in Mr Shamspeare's room. It shows the landlord, Mr Garrideb, together with a young man.
Evidence 12
Name: Bottle of Poison
Description: A bottle found in the possession of Miss Green with traces of the slow-acting poison strychnine inside.
Evidence 13
Name: Capital Offender's File
Description: Scotland Yard's file about the convicted criminal Selden that includes the newspaper article about him dying of illness in prison.
Evidence 14
Name: Miss Green's Card
Description: A note in an envelope that seems to have been ripped open rather roughly. It contains instructions to meet with someone who claims to have information about Duncan Ross. A note in an envelope that seems to have been ripped open rather roughly. The envelope fits perfectly with a torn-off piece found at the scene of the crime.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: It was around nine o'clock that evening when I visited my neighbour, and I took some tea with me as a gift.
Person: Soseki
Testimony 1
Testimony: We had a heated literary debate over a nice, hot drink. After which I went back to my room, at around eleven.
Person: Soseki
Testimony 2
Testimony: Argh! My tea was completely harmless! He couldn't have locked the door behind me otherwise, could he?
Person: Soseki
Testimony 3
Testimony: Strychnine takes some time to have an effect on the body. People don't keel over immediately after takin' it.
Person: Gregson
Testimony 4
Testimony: The victim would have been perfectly able to lock the door after his guest left. The argument still stands.
Person: Gregson

Testimony 0
Testimony: I'm proud to be the company's East End branch investigator and meter money collection agent.
Person: Metermann
Testimony 1
Testimony: Altamont gas meters accept thruppenny bits, each coin givin' customers about two hours of gorgeous gas!
Person: Metermann
Testimony 2

Person: Altamont
Testimony 3
Testimony: The meter doesn't appear to have been tampered with, though, and the collection agent has the only key.
Person: Altamont
Testimony 4
Testimony: All joints on the meter are welded shut, and the lock is made from solid steel. There's no way to dismantle it.
Person: Altamont
Testimony 5
Testimony: The meter is designed for coins the exact diameter and thickness of a thruppenny bit. Nothing else will fit.
Person: Altamont
Testimony 6
Testimony: Somehow, he's usin' all the flamin' gas he wants without payin' a penny! If that's not thievin', what is?!
Person: Metermann

Evidence 0
Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.
Evidence 1
Name: Great Exhibition Newspaper
Description: A newspaper containing various articles about the world-leading science and technology on show at the Great Exhibition being held in London.
Evidence 2
Name: Experiment Sketch
Description: A diagram showing the relative positions of the Crystal Tower and Professor Harebrayne's machine that exploded.
Evidence 3
Name: Mysterious Contraption → Crossbow
Description: A very curious device found behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds, almost as if it had been hidden there deliberately. A weapon found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It turns out that it's a folding crossbow. A crossbow found hidden behind a tree under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. It belongs to Mr Enoch Drebber.
Evidence 4
Name: Piece of Green Cloth
Description: A torn piece of canvas-like material backed with rubber that was found under the experimentation stage at the exhibition grounds. There are scorch marks at the edges.
Evidence 5
Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim taken after he had ostensibly been 'beamed' to the Crystal Tower. It shows an apparent stab wound to the chest.
Evidence 6
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the victim, Mr Asman. His neck was broken from the impact of a violent fall and he was stabbed in the chest with a sharp object.
Evidence 7
Name: Screwdriver
Description: Professor Harebrayne's trusty screwdriver that he's named 'Andrew'. There are traces of blood at the tip and it matches the shape of the victim's wound. A metal screwdriver that was found poking through the grille in the base of what remains of the kinesis machine. It has a very distinctive handle.
Evidence 8
Name: Photograph of the Balloon
Description: A photograph taken by Gotts whilst he was riding in a balloon. It shows another balloon that he claims was green and exploded moments after he took this shot.
Evidence 9
Name: Drebber's Card
Description: Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, though it shows only the man's name. There is no address. Mr Enoch Drebber's business card, which lists no address for the man. There is a smear of machine oil on the reverse.
Evidence 10
Name: Wooden 'Birdcage'
Description: The wooden cage that was used for Professor Harebrayne's experiment. This cage, with the victim inside, crashed down into the Crystal Tower. The wooden cage that was used for the demonstration. It crashed down, with the victim inside, into the Crystal Tower causing damage to its base.
Evidence 11
Name: Photograph of Drebber
Description: A photographic print of the engineer, Mr Enoch Drebber. It's hard to make out, but he appears to be wearing a monocle with black glass.
Evidence 12
Name: Camera
Description: The camera from around the neck of a waxwork in the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. The actual camera that Mr Drebber had with him ten years ago when he went graverobbing. When the lens is extended, dark staining can be seen on the bellows.
Evidence 13
Name: Piece of Broken Glass
Description: A small fragment of very unusual and thick glass that was found in the folds of the clothing of the Professor waxwork. It would appear to be from the Crystal Tower.
Evidence 14
Name: Science Trophy
Description: A Royal Society trophy for excellence in science that was found in Mr Drebber's workshop. It's a very prestigious award for a young scientist.
Evidence 15
Name: Waxwork Head
Description: The head of the Professor waxwork that was stolen from the Madame Tusspells Special Exhibit.
Evidence 16
Name: Killer's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the mass murderer known as the Professor, who was tried and found guilty by closed trial ten years ago.
Evidence 17
Name: Post-Explosion Photograph
Description: A photographic print of the experimentation stage after it was completely levelled by a time bomb. The metal floor of the stage has been blown open by the explosion.
Evidence 18
Name: Drebber's Contract
Description: The contract between Mr Asman and Mr Drebber detailing the terms by which they would profit from the kinesis experiment.
Evidence 19
Name: Ten-Year-Old Article
Description: A newspaper article recounting the tale of an eyewitness to the alleged 'resurrection' of the Professor from his grave on the night of his execution.

Testimony 0
Testimony: The corpse that went crashin' through the Crystal Tower had a broken neck.
Person: Gregson
Testimony 1
Testimony: I, I made a minor miscalculation in the angle of the beam projection, that's all! That was my mistake!
Person: Harebrayne
Testimony 2
Testimony: But the post-mortem examination revealed another injury. A fatal wound.
Person: Gregson
Testimony 3
Testimony: There was a lesion in his chest where he'd clearly been stabbed by somethin' sharp right in the heart!
Person: Gregson
Testimony 4
Testimony: So the victim was killed before he went anywhere. And this fella's the only one who could have done it!
Person: Gregson
Testimony 5
Testimony: The weapon the victim was stabbed with must have been left in his body whilst he was beamed through the air!
Person: Gregson

Description: A photographic print of a smiling Mrs Vigil in her younger years. It was found on a desk at the scene of the crime.

Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of the small room in the building of flats on Fresno Street where the body of the victim, Inspector Gregson, was found.

Description: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper of the Bailey. A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper. There is a bloody handprint on the back side.

Description: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. What sort of bang could it make...? The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. It goes off like a gunshot.

Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim, Inspector Gregson. His body appears to be tightly curled up and there's a red hairpiece on his head.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: We saw the whole thing from start to finish, we did. Everything from the moment they went in the building.
Person: Gossip
Testimony 1

Person: Venus
Testimony 2

Person: Sandwich

Person: Gossip
Testimony 4

Person: Gossip

Person: Venus

Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Armband
Description: An armband I inherited from Kazuma. It identifies the wearer as a defence lawyer throughout the Empire of Japan.
Evidence 1
Name: Red-Headed League Article
Description: An advertisement from the newspaper that's entitled 'To the Red-Headed League'. It seems somewhat suspicious in nature.
Evidence 2
Name: Photograph of Mr Vigil
Description: A photographic print received from Mrs Vigil in order to aid with locating her missing husband. He appears to have no particularly distinctive facial features.
Evidence 3
Name: Letter of Introduction
Description: A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. Hopefully now he'll be willing to talk to us. A note of introduction on our behalf from Professor Mikotoba to Governor Caidin. It's written on the back of a ticket for passage on a steamship.
Evidence 4
Name: Dismissal Notice
Description: The harsh reprimand incurred by Mr Vigil ten years ago that resulted in him losing his job as chief warder of Barclay Prison.
Evidence 5
Name: Red Hairpiece
Description: A flame-red wig found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Presumably it belonged to Inspector Gregson...
Evidence 6
Name: Candelabrum
Description: A candelabrum from the wall of the room on Fresno Street where the inspector was found dead. The top of one of the candles appears to have been blown off.
Evidence 7
Name: Revolver
Description: The murder weapon that was found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Probably best to avoid handling it.
Evidence 8
Name: Policeman Figurine
Description: A small and rather endearing model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. A model of a British policeman found at the scene of the crime on Fresno Street. Giving it a twist causes a key-like shaft to pop out from the base.
Evidence 9
Name: Framed Photograph
Description: A photographic print of a smiling Mrs Vigil in her younger years. It was found on a desk at the scene of the crime.
Evidence 10
Name: Gregson's Photograph
Description: An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office, as if it was a treasured memory. An old photographic print displayed rather prominently in Inspector Gregson's office. The person on the left is Lord Klint van Zieks.
Evidence 11
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: Inspector Gregson's autopsy report, stating that death was instant, resulting from a bullet shot at close range. The autopsy report from the examination of Inspector Gregson's body. According to the coroner, Dr Gorey, an accurate estimation of the time of death is not possible.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Scene Floor Plan
Description: A plan of the small room in the building of flats on Fresno Street where the body of the victim, Inspector Gregson, was found.
Evidence 13
Name: Noticeboard
Description: A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper of the Bailey. A free-standing noticeboard completely covered in notes and articles relating to victims of the Reaper. There is a bloody handprint on the back side.
Evidence 14
Name: Venus Firecracker
Description: The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. What sort of bang could it make...? The Venus Special firecracker consisting of one hundred smaller fireworks at sixpence each. It goes off like a gunshot.
Evidence 15
Name: Photograph of the Victim
Description: A photographic print of the victim, Inspector Gregson. His body appears to be tightly curled up and there's a red hairpiece on his head.
Evidence 16
Name: Gregson's Pocket Watch
Description: Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. It's no longer ticking and the glass over the face is cracked. Inspector Gregson's pocket watch that he wound without fail every single day. Having wound it up, it's started ticking again.
Evidence 17
Name: Inspector's Identification
Description: The identification of a man claiming to be a detective inspector, confiscated by Mr de Rousseau and Mr de Rossi. Inspector Gregson's police identification. It's the official warrant card issued to him by Scotland Yard.
Evidence 18
Name: Commemorative Photograph
Description: A photograph taken in the foyer of the Great Waterloo Hotel on the morning of Professor Mikotoba and Judge Jigoku's arrival in London for the symposium.
Evidence 19
Name: The Asogi Papers
Description: The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. Apparently Mr Asogi described it as 'the only weapon I have left'. The last will and testament of Genshin Asogi that Mr Vigil claims disappeared after the convict's execution. It seems there was a third page to it.
Evidence 20
Name: Gregson's Trunk
Description: Inspector Gregson's metal travelling trunk that was removed from the scene, but subsequently recovered by Gina.
Evidence 21
Name: Passport
Description: A passport document that was in Inspector Gregson's possession. It was issued for travel to France the day before his body was discovered.
Evidence 22
Name: Klint's Autopsy Report
Description: The autopsy report of the final victim of the infamous Professor. The report was authored by Dr John H. Wilson. The report from the autopsy of the Professor's final victim. It's signed by Dr John H. Wilson who carried out the procedure, though Professor Mikotoba actually penned the report.
Evidence 23
Name: Iris's Lucky Charm
Description: A little doll of Mr Sholmes in hare form. I've been told to tug its ears if I run out of options in the trial today...
Evidence 24
Name: Great Sword 'Karuma'
Description: The illustrious blade passed down through generations of the Asogi clan. The prized sword's tip has a small piece missing.
Evidence 25
Name: Evacuation Drill Itinerary
Description: A notice about a practice evacuation to be carried out by the crew of the SS Grouse the night before the ship arrived in Dover. It was found in Judge Jigoku's cabin.
Evidence 26
Name: Small Component
Description: A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. A small machine part that Mr Sholmes found in Judge Jigoku's cabin on the SS Grouse. Description: A ring belonging to Genshin Asogi found in Lord Klint van Zieks's stomach during the autopsy. The claws clasping the gem look sharp enough to cause a very nasty scratch.

Name: Klint van Zieks's Will
Description: The last will and testament of Lord Klint van Zieks that has been hidden inside the great sword Karuma for years. A trump card left behind by Genshin Asogi.

Person: Gossip
Testimony 1
Testimony: Well don't look at me. I 'aven't got a clue about it. I was doin' business with some second years at the time.
Person: Venus
Testimony 2

Person: Venus

Person: Sandwich

Person: Gossip

Person: Sandwich

Testimony 0
Testimony: We 'ad more zan one thousand red-'eaded people assemble in ze park on Lime Street zat day.
Person: De Rousseau
Testimony 1
Testimony: But I don't recall the man in this-a photograph. Ay, capo?
Person: De Rossi
Testimony 2
Testimony: Non, I don't remember 'im. Obviously 'e is dead now. But I assure you, 'e was not in ze park.
Person: De Rousseau
Testimony 3
Testimony: Allora! This victim is-a nothing to do with us!
Person: De Rossi
Testimony 4
Testimony: You 'ave a lot to answer for, Peppino. It is your fault zat we got caught in ze first place.
Person: De Rousseau

Testimony 0
Testimony: Ze, ze truth is, we took 'im prisoner and kept 'im for ze night at our secret 'ideout.
Person: De Rousseau
Testimony 1
Testimony: Even though I didn't sink 'e was a real detective, I, I was too scared to let 'im go zat day, just in case.
Person: De Rousseau

Person: De Rossi
Testimony 3

Person: Jigoku

Person: Jigoku

Testimony: As the warder responsible for condemned convicts, I attended to Mr Asogi and kept watch over his cell.

Person: Vigil

Characters:
Character 0
Name: ??? → Buddy Faith
Description: The victim in this case. Why was he killed in my office?
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 2
Name: Jacques Portsman
Description: A high prosecutor with this prosecutor's office. It's my first time speaking with him.
Character 3
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: Gumshoe knew her from when she was an officer. She now works as nighttime security.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Bullet went clean through the victim's abdomen. The body was found at around 2:05 AM.
Evidence 2
Name: Victim's Revolver
Description: It can be assumed that this gun is the murder weapon. It was issued to the victim. Issued to the victim and believed to be the murder weapon. Only 1 shot fired.
Evidence 3
Name: Secret Safe
Description: Each prosecutor has one in their office. Only they know of them. Trial evidence use. Each prosecutor has one in their office. Only they know of them. Prints were wiped.
Evidence 4
Name: Stolen File
Description: One of the files that were written upon in blood was stolen by the culprit. Pages pertaining to a case tried 10 years ago by my predecessor are missing.
Evidence 5
Name: Master Key
Description: This can open every office door. Its use is controlled by security staff. This can open every office door. It was stolen from the security office.
Evidence 6
Name: Mr. Portsman's Office
Description: Ms. Byrde unlocked the door, but master key was stolen, so she could not lock it up. Ms. Byrde says she unlocked this door, but her prints were not found on the doorknob.
Evidence 7
Name: Basketball Hoop
Description: It's sitting in front of Portsman's office. There are signs that it's been moved.
Evidence 8
Name: Note Left by Victim
Description: Found under the door, for the absent Portsman. [info] The following is written. I brought the 3 pieces of evidence by, just like we talked about on the phone, but it looks like you're out. Guess I'll catch up to you later. Buddy

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Detective Gumshoe. You stole Jim's gun from him and shot him dead.
Person: Portsman
Testimony 1
Testimony: Furthermore, you messed up the files to make it look like you had committed theft instead.
Person: Portsman
Testimony 2
Testimony: That's when you moved Jim's body that was sitting in front of the bookshelf!
Person: Portsman
Testimony 3
Testimony: But thanks to that, you didn't notice the bloody letters his body was hiding.
Person: Portsman
Testimony 4
Testimony: And it will be by his final words that you will be brought to justice.
Person: Portsman

Edgeworth:
(I suppose turbulence is to be expected on a flight. Though admittedly, I'm less than comfortable with anything resembling earthquakes... Hm? What's this...? A travel wallet? But it's not mine... How did someone else's travel wallet wind up in my pocket...? Nnngh...! My head... Why won't this headache go away...? I'll take care of this travel wallet later. Or hand it off to an attendant...) Unngh... From earthquake-like turbulence to an elevator... ............ Hmph. What am I doing hesitating like this? (Actually, I know full well why I hesitate. It was when I was still but a young child... I was caught up in a murder that happened in an elevator. But how long am I going to let my past haunt me!? It's just an elevator! I'm a grown man now! I need to behave like one!) Wh......What the...!? What in the world happened!?
???:
Is there something wrong, sir? I must ask that you please return to your se... ...eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeek! He... He-He-He's DEAD!!!

Time of Death - Pending autopsy

Name: Yatagarasu

Description: New rookie detective at the precinct. First crime scene. Seems very enthusiastic.

Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge

Evidence 2
Name: Det. Gumshoe's Testimony
Description: Was in hall on guard duty. Other than gunshot, didn't hear a sign of a struggle.
Evidence 3
Name: Handgun
Description: Was Faraday's evidence from Embassy staff killing case. It was found in his hand. Found in Faraday's hand. Bullet that killed Rell was fired from a few yards away.
Evidence 4
Name: Knife
Description: I believe Faraday brought this as evidence. It was found in Rell's hand. Weapon used to kill Faraday. Has the secret ability to change into key the Yatagarasu sent.
Evidence 5
Name: Crime Scene Notes
Description: Notes pertaining to Byrne Faraday and Mack Rell. [info] Victim
Byrne Faraday (Age: 40)
Mack Rell (Age: 32)

Time of Death
September 10
Approximately 4 PM
Discovered immediately after a gunshot was heard.


Remarks About the Bodies
Faraday died of a knife stab to the chest.
Rell died of a bullet wound to the chest. There is no gunpowder burn on his clothes, suggesting he was shot from a few yards away.

Name: Plastic Bag
Description: One of the bags strewn on floor of Lobby No. 2. Has Faraday's blood on it.

Description: Fountain pen used by the left-handed Faraday. Looks like it has a quality nib.

Description: Det. Gumshoe's annual bonus of $5. Literally had no money on him until he cashed this.

Name: Swiss Roll
Description: Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. Says "Courthouse Special" on it. Swiss roll dropped by the mysterious young girl. It's priced at 2 for $6. Detective Gumshoe and Kay bought this Swiss roll together.
Evidence 10

Description: He heard the gunshot right before the trial was about to start again.

Description: I just know I've seen a pink balloon around... Found on windowsill of the hallway window. Balloon popped by Kay. The Judge misheard its popping for a gunshot.

Evidence 5
Name: Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. [caption] The blade is red with blood, while the handle with the butterfly motif is completely clean. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue

Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Edgeworth:
Take a good look at these documents, Franziska.
Franziska:
It says that there are three pages in total, and yet, there are only two here.
Edgeworth:
Correct. Now take a look at the smuggling activity document in your possession. Tell me, is it not possible that your page was taken from this set of three?
Franziska:
Well, well... It certainly looks that way.
Edgeworth:
By putting our multi-part puzzle together, we seem to have arrived at an answer. And it seems that you have now found what you were looking for.
Franziska:
Yes, and with this, it has become crystal clear... ...that Mr. Coachen himself was responsible for the mass smuggling of Babahlese ink!

Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.

Description: Killed Kay's father 7 years ago. Claimed to be Yatagarasu and then made her escape.

Character 4

Description: Lang's trusty secretary. Level-headed, she supports him in his investigations.
Character 5
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Daughter of my mentor, Manfred von Karma. Cooperating w/ Interpol on smuggling case.
Character 6
Name: Colias Palaeno
Description: Ambassador of Babahl who will do absolutely everything for his country's tourism industry.
Character 7
Name: Manny Coachen
Description: The victim. Amb. Palaeno's secretary and secretariat. Apparently, was a good man.
Character 8
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: Boasts he has the highest arrest rate in Interpol. He is after the smuggling ring.
Character 9
Name: Quercus Alba
Description: Ambassador of Allebahst. Also retired army man. May explain why overly-harsh on himself.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The man under the Steel Samurai mask. Sadly, he is a friend from grade school.
Character 11
Name: Tyrell Badd
Description: Eagle-eyed homicide det. His partner was killed 7 yrs. ago. He's here after Calisto Yew.
Character 12
Name: Mask☆DeMasque II
Description: Opportunist unrelated to 1st DeMasque. Found in Allebahst. Real name: Ka-Shi Nou.

Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Embassy Guide
Description: Two countries share this building with borders.
Evidence 2
Name: Steel Samurai's Autograph
Description: Autograph with a sketch of his face and weapon.
Evidence 3
Name: Notes on Coachen's Body
Description: COD: single stab to base of neck. The body wasn't badly burnt by the fire.
Evidence 4
Name: Yatagarasu's Key
Description: The Yatagarasu stole this from this embassy 7 years ago. It is also a knife.
Evidence 5
Name: Knife → Babahlese Knife → Allebahstian Knife
Description: Covered in victim's blood, the blade matches the wound. Butterfly motif is noteworthy. 1 of a set of 3 ornamental knives. Covered in victim's blood, blade same as wound. The blade is definitely Allebahstian. Was this carried across country lines? Blade determined to be Allebahstian. The flower motif's petals are separate.
Evidence 6
Name: Babahl's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. It was a fake, but was swapped with the real one. Is originally from Allebahst.
Evidence 7
Name: Cohdopian Paper Document
Description: Accounting doc related to smuggling. Proof someone in 1 of the countries is ringleader. Doc related to smuggling of Babahlese ink. It appears to point to Mr. Coachen.
Evidence 8
Name: Babahlese Knife Handle
Description: Swapped with the real murder weapon's handle, its blade has yet to be found.
Evidence 9
Name: Counterfeit Bills
Description: Made with Babahlese ink, they are in circulation in Zheng Fa. It's hard to tell they're fake. Bills circulating in Zheng Fa. Made by Coachen. They were all burned up in Mr. Coachen's office in Babahl.
Evidence 10
Name: Babahlese Ink
Description: Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of some specific reason. Special whitcrystal oil-based ink. Limited export because of its use in counterfeiting.
Evidence 11
Name: DeMasque II's Note
Description: Request for the theft of the Primidux Statue with a map to where the statue is. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Same shape as notepad in Babahl office. Request to steal the Primidux Statue. Handwriting matches that of Manny Coachen.
Evidence 12
Name: Samurai Sword
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Is thought to be what killed DeMasque II.
Evidence 13
Name: Photo with Steel Samurai
Description: Taken in front of Allebahst's Statue before murder.
Evidence 14
Name: Passionflowers
Description: Two large flowers in bloom. The vines are supported by stakes and are still growing. Two large flowers in bloom. Ambassador Alba takes great care in growing them.
Evidence 15
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: Weapon that's used on stage. Larry hit it against a wall and bent it. It's hollow. Because he bent it, Larry couldn't do the "Early Summer Rain Jab!" special attack.
Evidence 16
Name: Allebahst's Primidux Statue
Description: Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Only Amb. and Secret. can touch. Both countries claim to own real one. Nat. treasure. Signs it was moved during murder. Bloodstained weapon used to kill DeMasque. Originally from Babahl's secretariat's office. Used to be real, but has been swapped with a fake from Babahl. Was used as a weapon.
Evidence 17
Name: Stand-In Request
Description: Request for Ms. Oldbag to stand in for Mindy, the Pink Princess actress who fell ill.
Evidence 18
Name: Letter from a Stalker
Description: For Ms. Oldbag. Has mistakes from bad penmanship.
Evidence 19
Name: Lady's Undershirt
Description: Found in office fireplace. There's only 1 person here who would own such a shirt. Found in office fireplace. Ms. Oldbag was drying it in the fireplace next door.
Evidence 20
Name: Samurai Dogs
Description: Present for embassy staff. Ms. Oldbag took and ate a few from the dressing room.
Evidence 21
Name: Silhouette Lantern
Description: Runs on whitcrystal oil, which burns green. It's a Babahlese souvenir.
Evidence 22
Name: Pick
Description: Found at the Open-Air Stage, it looks like a guitar pick. It's also wet for some reason.
Evidence 23
Name: Ms. Yew's Perfume
Description: This was left behind by Calisto Yew 7 years ago. Kay has been safe-guarding it.
Evidence 24
Name: Fountain Spouts
Description: Part of the Rose Garden pool. Auto-refills the water when the water level is too low.
Evidence 25
Name: Photo of Yatagarasu
Description: Taken from a building nearby at the moment of border crossing during the fire. Photo taken after the first fire on the 4th and 5th floors had taken place.
Evidence 26
Name: Fires in Babahl
Description: Two fires broke out in Babahl today.
Evidence 27
Name: Amb. Palaeno's Testimony
Description: Spilled Babahlese ink onto back wall while burning files in fireplace. Left ashes there.
Evidence 28
Name: Wire
Description: A good length of wire that was found wound up inside Babahl's grandfather clock in Mr. Coachen's office.
Evidence 29
Name: Revolving Fireplace Wall
Description: There are signs that the revolving fireplace wall on Babahl's side has been used. Yatagarasu escaped through the revolving fireplace wall and into the next room over.
Evidence 30
Name: Hair Sticks → Crossbow Arrows
Description: Hair sticks with a candy stripe pattern on them. There is some dirt on the tips. Thought to be hair sticks, they're passionflower support stakes from Allebahst office. Neither hair sticks nor support stakes, they're actually crossbow arrows.
Evidence 31
Name: Trump Card
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Card containing orders from boss of smuggling ring to Coachen.
Evidence 32
Name: Video Tape
Description: Evidence from KG-8. Faraday had obtained it once, but Ernest Amano had it stolen. Evidence from KG-8. Footage showing Coachen entering the KG-8 Incident's crime scene.
Evidence 33
Name: Counterfeit Plate
Description: This was found from within the fake Primidux Statue Alba smuggled into his country.
Evidence 34
Name: Amb. Alba's Wound
Description: Mr. Alba claims it's proof he was stabbed by DeMasque II, so it was justified defence.
Evidence 35
Name: Commemorative Photo
Description: Taken at Theatrum Neutralis. The murder weapon can be seen in Mr. Alba's bouquet.
Evidence 36
Name: Security Footage
Description: Footage of the entranceways into Babahl and Allebahst from the Theatrum Neutralis.
Evidence 37
Name: Pushcart
Description: Steel Samural pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. The bulge is unnatural. Steel Samurai pushed this to Allebahst from the dressing room. There is blood inside.

Testimony: During the first Babahlese fire, I assisted in putting out the fire.
Person: Shih-na

Testimony: During the second fire, I was searching for the Yatagarasu that had appeared in Babahl.

Person: Shih-na

Person: Shih-na
